      • draw

        public void draw(Graphic g,
        int x,
        int y,
        int z,
        java.lang.String text,
        int size,
        Color color)
        Draw a font with some nifty additions such as supporting text coloration parsing and breaklines. Inline coloration uses the syntax |RRRGGGBBB text | where the text in between the both "|" are colored with the color RRRGGGBBB where "RRR", "GGG", "BBB" is an integer in range 0-255. (they're wrapped back around if over 255)
        Parameters:
        g - the graphic handler
        x - of top-left coordinate
        y - of top-left coordinate
        z -
        text -
        size -
        color -

      • drawCentered

        public void drawCentered(Graphic g,
                int x,
                int y,
                int z,
                java.lang.String text,
                int size,
                Color color)
        Same drawing as drawFont but calulates the width of the string before to instead of using x,y as top left corner have x centered in the middle.
        Parameters:
        g -
        x -
        y -
        z -
        text -
        size -
        color -
